title: What is the best ringtone song ever? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you claim something as best, then there is always a reason behind it. An incident I would like to mention. Before that , just FYI : In MNCs , the most common ringtones you hear are trademark default ringtones of the mobile companies like : iphone (most common now a days), Lenovo , Motorola , Samsung …It was Nov or Dec 2016, I was in office, doing daily routine work , which included coding, discussions with clients, fight with test team for a defect (yes, I am in IT sector :p ), pressure from management to complete my task, mentor new joiners and blah blah blah….. and believe me, anyone can get tired and frustrated after 6–7 hours of this work. I was also little tired that day, and was almost yelling over phone and was thinking “What a messed up life and work I have got”. Suddenly someone’s phone rings up , and it was so loud that almost everyone in office took a time from the work and looked for the phone. Almost everyone either had a smile on their face or were laughing on choice of ringtone, but yes everyone at least smiled (Though 2–3 were there who were cursing as they were on call, they can be exempted). And the ringtone was : “Love You Zindagi…. Love You Zindagi ….. !!! ” (Link attached) (Zindagi means Life) and then I saw this girl, owner of the phone running and hoping happily (after a long day at work) to pick up the phone (ummm almost like some kid) … That time I realized , no matter how tiring your day was, no matter if you have messed up at work… it can be corrected.. If you take life too seriously , then it can take a toll on you… so keep loving your life, its the most precious thing… ——————— * please bare with my grammar and vocabulary * —————-

i will give some song name in both hindi or english . i will start from hindi telling something meri jaan Kabhi Na Kabhi To Miloge Hum Ko Yakeen Ha SareleMr.mickeyraajBaaton ko teri Nagin Tune by Jigar Fulaiya Dard DilokeShoaibJethwa siddhrajsinhSweet music for ringtone...............Aaj unse milna haiDiwana - QaXi MuXamil english:10.  Hello – Lionel Ritchie With a name like “Hello, this is easily an instant classic that will earn you an honorary Jheri-Curl.9.  Safety Dance – Men Without Hats “We can dance if we want to…”  Oh, they’ll want to dance, all right–thanks to your awesome taste.8.  Party All The Time – Eddie Murphy Eddie’s on this list twice (if once indirectly) and really, wouldn’t you want him to be?7. The Informer – Snow I can’t understand most of the lyrics and I’m not sure what corner of Europe Snow crawled out of, but who cares!6.  Rockit – Herbie Hancock The only instrumental track on this list, this is a funk-a-delic free for all that’ll have your friends doin‘ the robot.5.  Rainbow in the Dark – Dio A slightly angry, slightly campy, all-heart metal anthem for the demon at heart.  "Metal God."4.  I Wish Skee-Lo Ballers beware, Skee-Lo calls you out in this basketball ballad ’bout being to short to play ball or score chicks.4.  Hold the Line – Toto One of two phone-themed songs in this list, Toto brings classic 70’s piano rock to new heights in this masterpiece.3.  I Would Do Anything for Love (But I Won’t Do That) – Meatloaf Is further explanation of this song really necessary?2.  Axel F (Beverly Hills Cop Soundtrack) - Harold Faltermeyer Instantly recognizable and impossible to ignore–born to be a ringtone.  "You have the right to remain awesome."1.  How Will I Know – Whitney Houston
